s0.description:
You have met Wakdaar Manelay, your Afghan counterpart, a few times before. Today, you are meeting with Wakdaar to discuss your upcoming humanitarian assistance training session for Afghan military service members. Your objectives are to:

- Greet your counterpart appropriately.
- Respond appropriately to offers of hospitality.
- Engage in appropriate small talk.
- Respect your counterpart’s religious observances.
- Seek a local perspective before beginning your mission.
- Manage your counterpart’s expectations.

expectations_improve_training.L1: If it would improve their training, I'm sure I can make it happen.
expectations_improve_training.L2: ke cheray daa de doy de tamrinaat de permukhatya pe barkha tse gata laarey, ze yaaqin laaram chi kaaweley shem che daa kaar weklam.

expectations_not_happening.L1: Unfortunately, that’s not something I can make happen.
expectations_not_happening.L2: pe khwasheney, daa daase koom shey neda che ze barabara klam.

hospitality2_love_another_cup.L1: Yes, thank you. I'd love another cup.
hospitality2_love_another_cup.L2: ho, manana. ze yaw noor pyalaa chaay ghwaalam.

hospitality_no_plenty_tea.L1: No, thanks. I’ve had plenty of tea already.
hospitality_no_plenty_tea.L2: na, manana. deyr chaay me tskelay dey.

perspective2_female_team.L1: Could we train a female team for earthquake response?
perspective2_female_team.L2: moong kewaley shoo che yaw khazena team te de zelzeley pe mahaal de chamto kedal tamrinat warkloo?

perspective2_livestock.L1: Are people in earthquake zones concerned about livestock?
perspective2_livestock.L2: hagha khalek che de zelzeley pe saaha ke woswgee de khpel tsarawee pe khater andekhmand nadee?

perspective2_people_need.L1: What do people need most after an earthquake?
perspective2_people_need.L2: khalek zelzeley na pas tse ta deyr altyaa laarey?

perspective3_account_for_all.L1: We should try to account for all possibilities.
perspective3_account_for_all.L2: moong baayad che khpel hatsa wekloo aw har yaw emkanato bande nazar welaroo.

perspective3_needed_cities.L1: What would be most needed in cities?
perspective3_needed_cities.L2: pe kharono ke tse te be deyr altyaa wey?

perspective_drought_relief.L1: I hear droughts are a problem. We should focus on drought relief.
perspective_drought_relief.L2: ma awredaly che wechkaley yaw moshkel de. Moong baayad de wechkalay pe waakht de mraasta kaweloo pe haakla ghaawr wekloo.

perspective_schedule_planned.L1: Don’t worry, the training schedule is all planned.
perspective_schedule_planned.L2: be ghama wosey, de tamrenaat mahalweesh ter mekha jola showey de.

perspective_what_priorities.L1: What are your priorities for training?
perspective_what_priorities.L2: pe tamrenato ke staase lomlaytoob tse dey?

religion_go_ahead.L1: Please, go ahead. I’ll wait for you here.
religion_go_ahead.L2: hela kawem, taase khpel kaar wekrey. ze be delta intazar kawem.

religion_ill_come_back.L1: I’ll come back at another time that’s more convenient.
religion_ill_come_back.L2: daa be deyr monaaseba wee che ze be koom bel waakht rasham.

religion_you_just_arrived.L1: You just arrived. We can finish up really quick.
religion_you_just_arrived.L2: taase hamda oos ra wraaseda. moong kaaweley sho che daa be deyr zher sarta worasawoo.

smalltalk_soccer.L1: Did you watch the soccer game yesterday?
smalltalk_soccer.L2: taase paron de footbaal syaalay mo woomleda?

smalltalk_training_schedule.L1: Would you like to review the training schedule?
smalltalk_training_schedule.L2: ghwaaley che de tamrenaato mahalweesh wegoorey?

objectives.label: Respond appropriately to offers of hospitality.
Seek a local perspective before beginning your mission.

Aziz-ask_another_cup_before_L1.L1: Would you like another cup of tea before you leave?
Aziz-ask_another_cup_before_L1.L2: mekhke la teloona ghawlay che yaw bela pyalaa chaay wetskey?

Aziz-ask_another_useful_training_L2.L1: Is there another kind of training that would be more useful?
Aziz-ask_another_useful_training_L2.L2: koom bela tamrenaat shtaa dey che gatawara be wee?

Aziz-ask_experienced_disasters_L2.L1: I have some ideas, but you know Afghanistan better than I do. Have you experienced any natural disasters?
Aziz-ask_experienced_disasters_L2.L2: ze yaw tse nazaryee laram, staase pezhandgalwaey afghanistan pe alwaand maa na deyr dey. taase de tabeyee pekhoo pe barkha kom tajroba laarey?

Aziz-ask_it_is_plan_together_L1.L1: It is? I thought we were going to plan the session together.
Aziz-ask_it_is_plan_together_L1.L2: dasee da? Maa feker kawaal che mong dwalaa pe gada da pelaan be jolawoo.

Aziz-ask_planned_eq_relief_L1.L1: I'm sure what you've planned is fine. Have you planned for earthquake relief? Earthquakes are quite common here.
Aziz-ask_planned_eq_relief_L1.L2: ze yaqin laaram tse pelaan che taase jola keley khe dey. Taase de zelzelay de merasta pe alwand koma pelaan joola kelay dey? zeka che zelzelay pe dagha simoo ke har wakht pekhegee.

Aziz-ask_pour_you_tea_L1.L1: Yes, of course. Frank saayeb, may I pour you some tea?
Aziz-ask_pour_you_tea_L1.L2: ho yaqeenan. Frank saayeb taaso te yaw chaay wachawoom?

Aziz-ask_train_air_evac_L1.L1: Can we also train for air evacuations?
Aziz-ask_train_air_evac_L1.L2: kaaweley shoo che de hawa de tasfyaa kawalo tamrenaat ham taar sera kroo?

Aziz-expectations_handson_training_L2.L1: Maybe we can arrange some NGO coordination training instead.
Aziz-expectations_handson_training_L2.L2: de haghe pe dzaay shayad wu kaaweley shu che dzeeno NGO ganoona kaar wekhloo.

Aziz-expectations_improve_training_L2.L1: If it would improve their training, I'm sure I can make it happen.
Aziz-expectations_improve_training_L2.L2: ke cheray daa de doy de tamrinaat de permukhatya pe barkha tse gata laarey, ze yaaqin laaram chi kaaweley shem che daa kaar weklam.

Aziz-expectations_not_happening_L2.L1: Unfortunately, that’s not something I can make happen.
Aziz-expectations_not_happening_L2.L2: pe khwasheney, daa daase koom shey neda che ze barabara klam.

Aziz-hospitality2_love_another_cup_L2.L1: Yes, thank you. I'd love another cup.
Aziz-hospitality2_love_another_cup_L2.L2: ho, manana. ze yaw noor pyalaa chaay ghwaalam.

Aziz-hospitality_no_plenty_tea_L2.L1: No, thanks. I’ve had plenty of tea already.
Aziz-hospitality_no_plenty_tea_L2.L2: na, manana. deyr chaay me tskelay dey.

Aziz-perspective2_female_team_L2.L1: Could we train a female team for earthquake response?
Aziz-perspective2_female_team_L2.L2: moong kewaley shoo che yaw khazena team te de zelzeley pe mahaal de chamto kedal tamrinat warkloo?

Aziz-perspective2_livestock_L2.L1: Are people in earthquake zones concerned about livestock?
Aziz-perspective2_livestock_L2.L2: hagha khalek che de zelzeley pe saaha ke woswgee de khpel tsarawee pe khater andekhmand nadee?

Aziz-perspective2_people_need_L2.L1: What do people need most after an earthquake?
Aziz-perspective2_people_need_L2.L2: khalek zelzeley na pas tse ta deyr altyaa laarey?

Aziz-perspective3_account_for_all_L2.L1: We should try to account for all possibilities.
Aziz-perspective3_account_for_all_L2.L2: moong baayad che khpel hatsa wekloo aw har yaw emkanato bande nazar welaroo.

Aziz-perspective3_needed_cities_L2.L1: What would be most needed in cities?
Aziz-perspective3_needed_cities_L2.L2: pe kharono ke tse te be deyr altyaa wey?

Aziz-perspective_drought_relief_L2.L1: I hear droughts are a problem. We should focus on drought relief.
Aziz-perspective_drought_relief_L2.L2: ma awredaly che wechkaley yaw moshkel de. Moong baayad de wechkalay pe waakht de mraasta kaweloo pe haakla ghaawr wekloo.

Aziz-perspective_schedule_planned_L2.L1: Don’t worry, the training schedule is all planned.
Aziz-perspective_schedule_planned_L2.L2: be ghama wosey, de tamrenaat mahalweesh ter mekha jola showey de.

Aziz-perspective_what_priorities_L2.L1: What are your priorities for training?
Aziz-perspective_what_priorities_L2.L2: pe tamrenato ke staase lomlaytoob tse dey?

Aziz-religion_go_ahead_L2.L1: Please, go ahead. I’ll wait for you here.
Aziz-religion_go_ahead_L2.L2: hela kawem, taase khpel kaar wekrey. ze be delta intazar kawem.

Aziz-religion_ill_come_back_L2.L1: I’ll come back at another time that’s more convenient.
Aziz-religion_ill_come_back_L2.L2: daa be deyr monaaseba wee che ze be koom bel waakht rasham.

Aziz-religion_you_just_arrived_L2.L1: You just arrived. We can finish up really quick.
Aziz-religion_you_just_arrived_L2.L2: taase hamda oos ra wraaseda. moong kaaweley sho che daa be deyr zher sarta worasawoo.

Aziz-reply_basic_medical_supplies_L1.L1: People always need basic medical supplies and temporary shelters. Some houses here aren't safe.
Aziz-reply_basic_medical_supplies_L1.L2: khalek har waakht daroo, darmal, aw yo stoognay dzahey ta artyaa laarey. zeney korona delta de khatra na baahar neda.

Aziz-reply_dont_focus_livestock_L1.L1: I don’t think we should focus on caring for livestock.
Aziz-reply_dont_focus_livestock_L1.L2: ze feker na kawam che mong de tsarayoo de saareney pe alwand deyr pamlarena wekloo.

Aziz-reply_earthquakes_common_L1.L1: Maybe in some areas, but not this one. Earthquakes are more common here. They happen quite often.
Aziz-reply_earthquakes_common_L1.L2: dzeney seemo ke kedey shee, kho delata na. zelzelee delta yawa adee khabara de. hara waakht rapekhegee.

Aziz-reply_great_glad_to_hear_L1.L1: Great! I’m glad to hear that.
Aziz-reply_great_glad_to_hear_L1.L2: deyr aalaa! de dey awredelona khoshaala shwem.

Aziz-reply_great_to_hear_Frank_L1.L1: That's great to hear, Frank saayeb!
Aziz-reply_great_to_hear_Frank_L1.L2: de dey awredona deyra khoshaala yem, Frank saayeb.

Aziz-reply_less_concern_in_cities_L1.L1: Maybe, but people are less concerned about that in cities.
Aziz-reply_less_concern_in_cities_L1.L2: kedaay she kho pe kharoono ke khalek dasee masayloo bande domara andekhmand naadey.

Aziz-reply_meant_saaheb_L1.L1: Wakdaar jaan? I think you meant to say Wakdaar saayeb.
Aziz-reply_meant_saaheb_L1.L2: Wakdar jaan? ze feker kawam che taase ghokhtal che Wakdaar saayeb weywayee?

Aziz-reply_need_few_minutes_L1.L1: If you just wait here, I'll be back very soon.
Aziz-reply_need_few_minutes_L1.L2: ka cheray taaso delta yaw tse intizar basay, ze be deyr zher rabashem.

Aziz-reply_not_women_job_L1.L1: Women? Disaster relief is not a job for women.
Aziz-reply_not_women_job_L1.L2: khezay? dase pekhoo ke de mraastoo lepaara kakaledal de khezoo kaar neda.

Aziz-reply_right_hello_saaheb_L2.L1: Oh, right. I mean, hello, Wakdaar saayeb.
Aziz-reply_right_hello_saaheb_L2.L2: deyr khe. zmaa matlab wakdaar saaheb woo.

Aziz-reply_treatment_and_shelters_L1.L1: I think basic injury treatment and temporary shelters would be useful.
Aziz-reply_treatment_and_shelters_L1.L2: ze feker kawem che de adey zakhmono daarmal aw de yaw land mahaal panah dzai be deyr gatawaara be wey.

Aziz-reply_will_miss_prayer_L1.L1: If I don’t pray now, I will miss this prayer today.
Aziz-reply_will_miss_prayer_L1.L2: ka chere ze hamda oos moonz wonakrem, manza me qazaa kegee.

Aziz-reply_yes_favorite_sport_L2.L1: Yes, I do. It's more popular here than in America, but it's my favorite sport.
Aziz-reply_yes_favorite_sport_L2.L2: ho khwakhigime, de amrekee na delta deyra mashhora dey, kho zmaa deyra ghwara Loba dey.

Aziz-reply_yes_good_match_L1.L1: Yes! It was a good match. You like soccer?
Aziz-reply_yes_good_match_L1.L2: ho yaw deyr khe syalay woo. Footbal staase khwakh dey?

Aziz-reply_you_determine_L1.L1: I was hoping you could determine what we should cover.
Aziz-reply_you_determine_L1.L2: ze helamand woom che taase daa moshakhas kaleywey che moong tse baayad wekroo.

Aziz-say_adjust_topics_L2.L1: I guess we can still adjust the topics. What do you have in mind?
Aziz-say_adjust_topics_L2.L2: ze feker kawam laa tar osaa kawola shoo che de daghe masala bande paam wekloo.

Aziz-say_alot_to_cover_L2.L1: I’m sorry. We have a lot to cover. I didn’t mean to offend you.
Aziz-say_alot_to_cover_L2.L2: ze bakhena ghwalam. kho deyr masayel de che bayad worbandi ghawr weshey. zmaa matalab da nawoo che taase khwabade klam.

Aziz-say_alright_ill_wait_L2.L1: Alright. Go ahead. I'll wait for you here.
Aziz-say_alright_ill_wait_L2.L2: koma khabara neda. taase khpel kaar wokley. ze be hamdelta staase intezar baasam.

Aziz-say_another_anytime_L1.L2: hara waakht kedey shey che byaa ra pekh she.

Aziz-say_both_healthy_L1.L1: They are both healthy, thank God.
Aziz-say_both_healthy_L1.L2: dwaara de khodaay pe fazel joor de.

Aziz-say_change_your_mind_L1.L1: I’ll pour you a cup now in case you change your mind.
Aziz-say_change_your_mind_L1.L2: ze be yaw payala derta achawam kedaay she che zela de woshee.

Aziz-say_everyone_is_healthy_L1.L1: Very well. Everyone is healthy, thank God.
Aziz-say_everyone_is_healthy_L1.L2: de khodaay pe fazel, har yaw joor de.

Aziz-say_glad_to_help_L2.L2: khoshaala yem che tse mraasta weklam.

Aziz-say_good_to_see_you_L1.L1: It’s good to see you again.
Aziz-say_good_to_see_you_L1.L2: deyr khe sho che taase may byaa wooledal.

Aziz-say_i_am_healthy_L1.L2: de khodaay fazel dey, zmaa sehat khe dey.

Aziz-say_its_okay_let_you_go_L2.L1: It’s okay, I’ll let you go. I have other things I should attend to.
Aziz-say_its_okay_let_you_go_L2.L2: khair de, taase kaweley shey che laar shey. zmaa noor chaaree shta che ze bayad de haghooy tsarena weklam.

Aziz-say_learn_air_evac_L1.L1: I’d really like my soldiers to learn to conduct air evacuations.
Aziz-say_learn_air_evac_L1.L2: ze pe khpela deyr khoshaal kegama ke cherey zmaa afraad de hawaa de tasfyaa kewaalo tareeqa zda klee.

Aziz-say_leave_with_permission_L2.L1: I apologize, Wakdaar saayeb, but with your permission, I must go. I have to get to another meeting.
Aziz-say_leave_with_permission_L2.L2: ze bekhana ghwalaam, Wakdaar saayeb, kho staase pe ejaaza, ze bayad che laar shem, aw dzaan bela ghwanda te wraasawom.

Aziz-say_lets_discuss_plans_L1.L1: Thank you. Let's discuss the plans for this week's training session.
Aziz-say_lets_discuss_plans_L1.L2: manana. razey che de dey weney de tamrenaato plaan pe hakla khabarey wekroo.

Aziz-say_lets_go_over_L2.L2: razee che de pe alwand khabarey wekloo.

Aziz-say_must_go_pray_be_back_L1.L1: Please excuse me. I must go pray now. Inshallah I will be back in a few minutes.
Aziz-say_must_go_pray_be_back_L1.L2: hela kawem maa webakhay. ze bayad che oos monza te laar sham. inshallah yaw tsee wrosta be berta razam.

Aziz-say_must_go_pray_goodbye_L1.L1: Please excuse me. I must go pray now. Goodbye, Frank saayeb.
Aziz-say_must_go_pray_goodbye_L1.L2: hela kawem maa webakhay. ze bayad che monza te laar shem. de khuda pe amaan, Frank saayeb.

Aziz-say_my_terp_aziz_L2.L1: You remember my interpreter, Aziz Kaamawal.
Aziz-say_my_terp_aziz_L2.L2: taase te zmaa tarjoomaan Aziz Kamawal pe yaad de?

Aziz-say_rush_to_talk_L1.L1: You’re in such a rush to talk about business.
Aziz-say_rush_to_talk_L1.L2: taase deyra pe bera ghawley che de kaarono pe hakla khabrey wookley.

Aziz-say_thank_you_enjoy_tea_L1.L1: Thank you. Enjoy your tea until I come back.
Aziz-say_thank_you_enjoy_tea_L1.L2: ter hagha pore che ze berta razam taaso khple chaay wetsekey.

Aziz-say_that_seems_difficult_L2.L1: That seems like it would be pretty difficult to set up.
Aziz-say_that_seems_difficult_L2.L2: dasay khkarigey che de day tayara wal, deyr be moshkel wey.

Aziz-say_that_would_be_useful_L1.L1: Yes, I think that would be useful.
Aziz-say_that_would_be_useful_L1.L2: ho, ze feker kaawem da ba khe wey.

Aziz-say_training_for_that_L2.L1: Alright. We can include training for that in the session.
Aziz-say_training_for_that_L2.L2: sama da. moong kewolay shoo che daa mawzoo de khpel tamrenaato pe daawareke zyaata kloo.

Aziz-say_yes_earthquakes_L1.L1: Yes. Earthquakes happen quite often where I'm from.
Aziz-say_yes_earthquakes_L1.L2: ho. kom dzaay na che za yem halta har waakht zelzeley kegey.

Aziz-say_you_can_arrange_it_L1.L1: I know you can arrange it for us, Frank saayeb.
Aziz-say_you_can_arrange_it_L1.L2: ze pohegam taaso kaaweley shey che daa moong ta barabar kley, Frank saayeb.

Aziz-say_youll_like_tea_L1.L1: You'll like this tea. I will pour you a cup.
Aziz-say_youll_like_tea_L1.L2: daa chaay ba staa khwakh she. ze be yaw payala derta achawam.

Aziz-smalltalk_soccer_L2.L1: Did you watch the soccer game yesterday?
Aziz-smalltalk_soccer_L2.L2: taase paron de footbaal syaalay mo woomleda?

Aziz-smalltalk_training_schedule_L2.L1: Would you like to review the training schedule?
Aziz-smalltalk_training_schedule_L2.L2: ghwaaley che de tamrenaato mahalweesh wegoorey?

Frank-ask_another_useful_training_L1.L1: Is there another kind of training that would be more useful?
Frank-ask_another_useful_training_L1.L2: koom bela tamrenaat shtaa dey che gatawara be wee?

Frank-ask_experienced_disasters_L1.L1: I have some ideas, but you know Afghanistan better than I do. Have you experienced any natural disasters?
Frank-ask_experienced_disasters_L1.L2: ze yaw tse nazaryee laram, staase pezhandgalwaey afghanistan pe alwaand maa na deyr dey. taase de tabeyee pekhoo pe barkha kom tajroba laarey?

Frank-expectations_handson_training_L1.L1: Maybe we can arrange some NGO coordination training instead.
Frank-expectations_handson_training_L1.L2: de haghe pe dzaay shayad wu kaaweley shu che dzeeno NGO ganoona kaar wekhloo.

Frank-reply_right_hello_saaheb_L1.L1: Oh, right. I mean, hello, Wakdaar saayeb.
Frank-reply_right_hello_saaheb_L1.L2: deyr khe. zmaa matlab wakdaar saaheb woo.

Frank-reply_yes_favorite_sport_L1.L1: Yes, I do. It's more popular here than in America, but it's my favorite sport.
Frank-reply_yes_favorite_sport_L1.L2: ho khwakhigime, de amrekee na delta deyra mashhora dey, kho zmaa deyra ghwara Loba dey.

Frank-say_adjust_topics_L1.L1: I guess we can still adjust the topics. What do you have in mind?
Frank-say_adjust_topics_L1.L2: ze feker kawam laa tar osaa kawola shoo che de daghe masala bande paam wekloo.

Frank-say_alot_to_cover_L1.L1: I’m sorry. We have a lot to cover. I didn’t mean to offend you.
Frank-say_alot_to_cover_L1.L2: ze bakhena ghwalam. kho deyr masayel de che bayad worbandi ghawr weshey. zmaa matalab da nawoo che taase khwabade klam.

Frank-say_alright_ill_wait_L1.L1: Alright. Go ahead. I'll wait for you here.
Frank-say_alright_ill_wait_L1.L2: koma khabara neda. taase khpel kaar wokley. ze be hamdelta staase intezar baasam.

Frank-say_glad_to_help_L1.L2: khoshaala yem che tse mraasta weklam.

Frank-say_its_okay_let_you_go_L1.L1: It’s okay, I’ll let you go. I have other things I should attend to.
Frank-say_its_okay_let_you_go_L1.L2: khair de, taase kaweley shey che laar shey. zmaa noor chaaree shta che ze bayad de haghooy tsarena weklam.

Frank-say_leave_with_permission_L1.L1: I apologize, Wakdaar saayeb, but with your permission, I must go. I have to get to another meeting.
Frank-say_leave_with_permission_L1.L2: ze bekhana ghwalaam, Wakdaar saayeb, kho staase pe ejaaza, ze bayad che laar shem, aw dzaan bela ghwanda te wraasawom.

Frank-say_lets_go_over_L1.L2: razee che de pe alwand khabarey wekloo.

Frank-say_my_terp_aziz_L1.L1: You remember my interpreter, Aziz Kaamawal.
Frank-say_my_terp_aziz_L1.L2: taase te zmaa tarjoomaan Aziz Kamawal pe yaad de?

Frank-say_that_seems_difficult_L1.L1: That seems like it would be pretty difficult to set up.
Frank-say_that_seems_difficult_L1.L2: dasay khkarigey che de day tayara wal, deyr be moshkel wey.

Frank-say_training_for_that_L1.L1: Alright. We can include training for that in the session.
Frank-say_training_for_that_L1.L2: sama da. moong kewolay shoo che daa mawzoo de khpel tamrenaato pe daawareke zyaata kloo.

Wakdaar-ask_another_cup_before_L2.L1: Would you like another cup of tea before you leave?
Wakdaar-ask_another_cup_before_L2.L2: mekhke la teloona ghawlay che yaw bela pyalaa chaay wetskey?

Wakdaar-ask_it_is_plan_together_L2.L1: It is? I thought we were going to plan the session together.
Wakdaar-ask_it_is_plan_together_L2.L2: dasee da? Maa feker kawaal che mong dwalaa pe gada da pelaan be jolawoo.

Wakdaar-ask_planned_eq_relief_L2.L1: I'm sure what you've planned is fine. Have you planned for earthquake relief? Earthquakes are quite common here.
Wakdaar-ask_planned_eq_relief_L2.L2: ze yaqin laaram tse pelaan che taase jola keley khe dey. Taase de zelzelay de merasta pe alwand koma pelaan joola kelay dey? zeka che zelzelay pe dagha simoo ke har wakht pekhegee.

Wakdaar-ask_pour_you_tea_L2.L1: Yes, of course. Frank saayeb, may I pour you some tea?
Wakdaar-ask_pour_you_tea_L2.L2: ho yaqeenan. Frank saayeb taaso te yaw chaay wachawoom?

Wakdaar-ask_train_air_evac_L2.L1: Can we also train for air evacuations?
Wakdaar-ask_train_air_evac_L2.L2: kaaweley shoo che de hawa de tasfyaa kawalo tamrenaat ham taar sera kroo?

Wakdaar-reply_basic_medical_supplies_L2.L1: People always need basic medical supplies and temporary shelters. Some houses here aren't safe.
Wakdaar-reply_basic_medical_supplies_L2.L2: khalek har waakht daroo, darmal, aw yo stoognay dzahey ta artyaa laarey. zeney korona delta de khatra na baahar neda.

Wakdaar-reply_dont_focus_livestock_L2.L1: I don’t think we should focus on caring for livestock.
Wakdaar-reply_dont_focus_livestock_L2.L2: ze feker na kawam che mong de tsarayoo de saareney pe alwand deyr pamlarena wekloo.

Wakdaar-reply_earthquakes_common_L2.L1: Maybe in some areas, but not this one. Earthquakes are more common here. They happen quite often.
Wakdaar-reply_earthquakes_common_L2.L2: dzeney seemo ke kedey shee, kho delata na. zelzelee delta yawa adee khabara de. hara waakht rapekhegee.

Wakdaar-reply_great_glad_to_hear_L2.L1: Great! I’m glad to hear that.
Wakdaar-reply_great_glad_to_hear_L2.L2: deyr aalaa! de dey awredelona khoshaala shwem.

Wakdaar-reply_great_to_hear_Frank_L2.L1: That's great to hear, Frank saayeb!
Wakdaar-reply_great_to_hear_Frank_L2.L2: de dey awredona deyra khoshaala yem, Frank saayeb.

Wakdaar-reply_less_concern_in_cities_L2.L1: Maybe, but people are less concerned about that in cities.
Wakdaar-reply_less_concern_in_cities_L2.L2: kedaay she kho pe kharoono ke khalek dasee masayloo bande domara andekhmand naadey.

Wakdaar-reply_meant_saaheb_L2.L1: Wakdaar jaan? I think you meant to say Wakdaar saayeb.
Wakdaar-reply_meant_saaheb_L2.L2: Wakdar jaan? ze feker kawam che taase ghokhtal che Wakdaar saayeb weywayee?

Wakdaar-reply_need_few_minutes_L2.L1: If you just wait here, I'll be back very soon.
Wakdaar-reply_need_few_minutes_L2.L2: ka cheray taaso delta yaw tse intizar basay, ze be deyr zher rabashem.

Wakdaar-reply_not_women_job_L2.L1: Women? Disaster relief is not a job for women.
Wakdaar-reply_not_women_job_L2.L2: khezay? dase pekhoo ke de mraastoo lepaara kakaledal de khezoo kaar neda.

Wakdaar-reply_treatment_and_shelters_L2.L1: I think basic injury treatment and temporary shelters would be useful.
Wakdaar-reply_treatment_and_shelters_L2.L2: ze feker kawem che de adey zakhmono daarmal aw de yaw land mahaal panah dzai be deyr gatawaara be wey.

Wakdaar-reply_will_miss_prayer_L2.L1: If I don’t pray now, I will miss this prayer today.
Wakdaar-reply_will_miss_prayer_L2.L2: ka chere ze hamda oos moonz wonakrem, manza me qazaa kegee.

Wakdaar-reply_yes_good_match_L2.L1: Yes! It was a good match. You like soccer?
Wakdaar-reply_yes_good_match_L2.L2: ho yaw deyr khe syalay woo. Footbal staase khwakh dey?

Wakdaar-reply_you_determine_L2.L1: I was hoping you could determine what we should cover.
Wakdaar-reply_you_determine_L2.L2: ze helamand woom che taase daa moshakhas kaleywey che moong tse baayad wekroo.

Wakdaar-say_another_anytime_L2.L2: hara waakht kedey shey che byaa ra pekh she.

Wakdaar-say_both_healthy_L2.L1: They are both healthy, thank God.
Wakdaar-say_both_healthy_L2.L2: dwaara de khodaay pe fazel joor de.

Wakdaar-say_change_your_mind_L2.L1: I’ll pour you a cup now in case you change your mind.
Wakdaar-say_change_your_mind_L2.L2: ze be yaw payala derta achawam kedaay she che zela de woshee.

Wakdaar-say_everyone_is_healthy_L2.L1: Very well. Everyone is healthy, thank God.
Wakdaar-say_everyone_is_healthy_L2.L2: de khodaay pe fazel, har yaw joor de.

Wakdaar-say_good_to_see_you_L2.L1: It’s good to see you again.
Wakdaar-say_good_to_see_you_L2.L2: deyr khe sho che taase may byaa wooledal.

Wakdaar-say_i_am_healthy_L2.L2: de khodaay fazel dey, zmaa sehat khe dey.

Wakdaar-say_learn_air_evac_L2.L1: I’d really like my soldiers to learn to conduct air evacuations.
Wakdaar-say_learn_air_evac_L2.L2: ze pe khpela deyr khoshaal kegama ke cherey zmaa afraad de hawaa de tasfyaa kewaalo tareeqa zda klee.

Wakdaar-say_lets_discuss_plans_L2.L1: Thank you. Let's discuss the plans for this week's training session.
Wakdaar-say_lets_discuss_plans_L2.L2: manana. razey che de dey weney de tamrenaato plaan pe hakla khabarey wekroo.

Wakdaar-say_must_go_pray_be_back_L2.L1: Please excuse me. I must go pray now. Inshallah I will be back in a few minutes.
Wakdaar-say_must_go_pray_be_back_L2.L2: hela kawem maa webakhay. ze bayad che oos monza te laar sham. inshallah yaw tsee wrosta be berta razam.

Wakdaar-say_must_go_pray_goodbye_L2.L1: Please excuse me. I must go pray now. Goodbye, Frank saayeb.
Wakdaar-say_must_go_pray_goodbye_L2.L2: hela kawem maa webakhay. ze bayad che monza te laar shem. de khuda pe amaan, Frank saayeb.

Wakdaar-say_rush_to_talk_L2.L1: You’re in such a rush to talk about business.
Wakdaar-say_rush_to_talk_L2.L2: taase deyra pe bera ghawley che de kaarono pe hakla khabrey wookley.

Wakdaar-say_thank_you_enjoy_tea_L2.L1: Thank you. Enjoy your tea until I come back.
Wakdaar-say_thank_you_enjoy_tea_L2.L2: ter hagha pore che ze berta razam taaso khple chaay wetsekey.

Wakdaar-say_that_would_be_useful_L2.L1: Yes, I think that would be useful.
Wakdaar-say_that_would_be_useful_L2.L2: ho, ze feker kaawem da ba khe wey.

Wakdaar-say_yes_earthquakes_L2.L1: Yes. Earthquakes happen quite often where I'm from.
Wakdaar-say_yes_earthquakes_L2.L2: ho. kom dzaay na che za yem halta har waakht zelzeley kegey.

Wakdaar-say_you_can_arrange_it_L2.L1: I know you can arrange it for us, Frank saayeb.
Wakdaar-say_you_can_arrange_it_L2.L2: ze pohegam taaso kaaweley shey che daa moong ta barabar kley, Frank saayeb.

Wakdaar-say_youll_like_tea_L2.L1: You'll like this tea. I will pour you a cup.
Wakdaar-say_youll_like_tea_L2.L2: daa chaay ba staa khwakh she. ze be yaw payala derta achawam.
